DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Other Infectious Disease Marker Assessment Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the other infectious disease marker and assessment performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Other Infectious Disease Marker
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003_Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003:Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
